issues.title: Include command eventId and potentially other info into validation messages
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Validation error messages lack context about which specific command caused the failure, making it difficult to troubleshoot issues when multiple similar commands are scheduled. Request to include eventId and other contextual information in validation messages.

issues.title: MySQL Password is displayed in plain text in log file when Temporal cluster is bootstrapped
issues.author: Sun-ship-it
issues.summary: MySQL database password is displayed in plain text in log files during Temporal cluster bootstrap, exposing sensitive credentials. The log statement should either obfuscate the password or avoid including it entirely.

issues.title: Setup auto release to Docker Hub
issues.author: hazcod
issues.summary: Releases are not being automatically pushed to Docker Hub after GitHub releases are created. Currently this requires manual intervention, resulting in Docker Hub missing recent releases.

issues.title: temporal Docker fails to bind on multiple interfaces
issues.author: hazcod
issues.summary: Temporal Docker container fails to bind when connected to multiple Docker networks, as it receives multiple IP addresses as a single string which the IPv4 parser cannot handle. The container needs to bind to 0.0.0.0 instead of specific IPs in multi-network scenarios.

issues.title: ChildWorkflows not being retried with MySQL persistence
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Child workflow retries were not working properly with MySQL persistence in Temporal server. The issue was reported as a potential port from Cadence but was later verified to not reproduce on the latest Temporal server bits.

issues.title: Limit depth of child workflows
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to add a configurable depth limit for child workflow creation to prevent infinite recursion due to programming mistakes. A commenter suggests also considering cycle detection or DAG validation.

issues.title: docker/README.md and graphite support
issues.author: mkjt2
issues.summary: Docker Compose README documentation claims graphite metrics dashboard is available at localhost:8080/dashboard, but the default docker-compose.yml (with Cassandra) does not actually run graphite, making the dashboard inaccessible.

issues.title: docker-compose-postres.yml: setting POSTGRES_PWD to empty causes POSTGRES_SEEDS to be ignored
issues.author: markmark206
issues.summary: Setting POSTGRES_PWD to empty in docker-compose-postgres.yml causes the POSTGRES_SEEDS environment variable to be ignored and defaults to 127.0.0.1, preventing users from specifying custom database seed hosts.

issues.title: Activity tasks getting lost on matching role restarts
issues.author: samarabbas
issues.summary: Activity tasks are getting lost when matching roles restart, causing scheduled activities to timeout with SCHEDULE_TO_START errors instead of being dispatched to workers. This results in workflows getting stuck waiting for activity execution.

issues.title: If a temporal service fails to start due to a missing config key, log the missing key
issues.author: markmark206
issues.summary: When Temporal service startup fails due to missing configuration keys, the error log doesn't include the name of the missing key, making debugging difficult. Request to improve error messaging by logging the specific key name that caused the validation failure.

issues.title: dial tcp 127.0.0.1:26257: connect: connection refused
issues.author: hazcod
issues.summary: Temporal Server fails to connect to CockroachDB on port 26257 with 'connection refused' error during Docker startup, even though the database schema setup succeeds and the port appears accessible via netcat.

issues.title: Feature: implement docker healthcheck
issues.author: hazcod
issues.summary: Docker container is considered ready by the orchestration system before Temporal services have finished warming up, causing connection failures. The request is to implement a HEALTHCHECK directive in the Dockerfile to signal readiness only after services are fully initialized.

issues.title: Support gRPC Reflection API
issues.author: cvanderschuere
issues.summary: Add gRPC Reflection API support to enable tools like grpcurl and grpcui to explore Temporal Frontend APIs without requiring protobuf definitions. This feature was blocked by protobuf library constraints but became possible after migrating from gogo to google protobuf generation.

issues.title: Ringpop issues with docker swarm mode
issues.author: tiagoad
issues.summary: Temporal fails to start in Docker Swarm mode due to Ringpop membership issues. The service encounters broadcast address resolution errors on startup and connection timeout problems after restarts, with increasing cluster_membership table entries on each restart.

issues.title: Turn on consistent query by default
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Consistent query feature is disabled by default in clusters, but should be enabled by default or the toggle should be removed entirely to ensure consistent behavior.

issues.title: Child workflow is not retried if retryPolicy.maximumAttempts is not set
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Child workflow fails to retry when retryPolicy is set but retryPolicy.maximumAttempts is 0 or not set. The server needs intelligent defaults for child workflow retry options instead of relying on explicit client-side settings.

issues.title: lastEventId is not enough to protect mutable state updates
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Race conditions exist in mutable state updates because they rely only on lastEventId for conditional protection, while operations like retries and heartbeats don't increase history size, potentially causing concurrent update conflicts.

issues.title: Extend broadcast address capability to support broadcast port
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: Request to add broadcastPort configuration option alongside existing broadcastAddress to support dynamic port mapping scenarios in Temporal Server.

issues.title: Repeated "New timer generated is less than read level" in logs after adding node to cluster
issues.author: kelnos
issues.summary: After adding a second node to a single-node Temporal cluster, the original node repeatedly logs 'New timer generated is less than read level' warnings at ~1 second intervals. The issue appears to be related to shard timer management during cluster scaling.

issues.title: Workflows configured to run on a CRON schedule stop after a few executions
issues.author: arvindsampath
issues.summary: CRON-scheduled workflows stop executing after a few runs in server version 0.23.1 due to incorrect timeout configuration. The issue occurs when using WorkflowExecutionTimeout instead of WorkflowRunTimeout, as the former caps the total duration for all periodic executions.

issues.title: Add admin command to dump dynamic config value[s]
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Add an admin command to dump dynamic configuration values for the Temporal cluster to help with troubleshooting and visibility into current configuration state.

issues.title: "reset" canary fails with panic "lookup failed for scheduledID to activityID: scheduleID: 8, activity: 8"
issues.author: skrul
issues.summary: The reset canary fails with a panic when processing scheduled activities, logging 'lookup failed for scheduledID to activityID' error during workflow task processing in the Go SDK v0.22.8.

issues.title: Go SDK does not send temporal_workflow_start for child workflows
issues.author: skrul
issues.summary: The Go SDK does not emit `temporal_workflow_start` metrics for child workflows, creating an asymmetry where child workflow completions are tracked but their starts are not. The issue was resolved by migrating from `temporal_workflow_start` to granular `temporal_request` metrics tagged with API names.

issues.title: Workflow query consistency level (CLI and SDK)
issues.author: kaushiksriram100
issues.summary: Feature request to improve workflow query consistency by making strong consistency the default and updating documentation. The user encountered an error when attempting strongly consistent queries and had to manually enable a dynamic config setting.

issues.title: Temporal CLI querying workflow status.
issues.author: kaushiksriram100
issues.summary: Temporal CLI workflow query command returns JSON unmarshal errors when querying with certain query types like __open_sessions or getStats, failing to properly decode response payloads.

issues.title: Canary memory usage always increasing
issues.author: skrul
issues.summary: Memory usage in the canary process continuously increases over time, eventually exhausting 1GB of memory after about three days and causing an out-of-memory (OOM) kill in the Kubernetes cluster.

issues.title: FYI: python-betterproto compatibility
issues.author: firdaus
issues.summary: python-betterproto compatibility issues were identified with temporal-proto: recursive Failure object initialization causing stack overflow, and 'None' being a reserved Python keyword in QueryRejectCondition enum values. Author notes these are betterproto limitations, not proto issues, and plans to fork betterproto to accommodate.

issues.title: StartChildWorklfowExecution.WorkflowExecutionFailedCause doesn't make sense
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: StartChildWorkflowExecution failure enum includes UnknownExternalWorkflowExecution which is inappropriate for workflow creation. The enum should be separated into distinct types for starting workflows versus signaling/canceling external executions.

issues.title: CRON: Add flag to indicate that the first run should start immediately
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Feature request to add a flag allowing CRON workflows to execute their first run immediately instead of waiting for the scheduled time. Currently, the first execution always follows the cron schedule.

issues.title: Add ability to execute waiting cron immediately
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to add the ability to force immediate execution of a waiting cron workflow without terminating it or creating a new workflow with a different ID. The feature has been implemented using TerminateIfRunning policy and SignalWithStartWorkflowExecution.

issues.title: Canary exits when namespace exists
issues.author: skrul
issues.summary: Canary process exits with error when the 'canary' namespace already exists, instead of silently ignoring the AlreadyExists error as in prior versions. This breaks canary startup on clusters with existing namespaces.

issues.title: canary not running properly on v0.23.0
issues.author: skrul
issues.summary: Canary workflow stops executing after ~20 minutes on v0.23.0, with the cron workflow being invoked repeatedly but never spawning the sanity workflow. The timer_tasks table grows at >1 row/second, and the reset canary fails consistently.

issues.title: temporal-sql-tool's "dryrun" option is confusing
issues.author: skrul
issues.summary: The dryrun option in temporal-sql-tool misleads users by appearing to simulate schema changes without applying them, but actually executes the schema updates regardless. The feature was removed because it provided false confidence without meaningful protection.

issues.title: XDC replication not working
issues.author: kaushiksriram100
issues.summary: XDC (cross-datacenter) replication failing with two errors: ShardId not set on deserialization and connection timeouts to incorrect worker port (7233 instead of 7239). Workflows don't continue after namespace failover between clusters.

issues.title: Change ParentClosePolicy to struct and add applyOnParentContinueAsNew
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: ParentClosePolicy is currently always applied when a parent workflow calls continue-as-new, but in most cases it should only apply when the parent completes. The request is to restructure ParentClosePolicy as a struct with an applyOnParentContinueAsNew field to control this behavior.

issues.title: docker-compose-es.yml docker-compose fails with error 137
issues.author: pratyoosh
issues.summary: Docker Compose with Elasticsearch fails on macOS Catalina due to insufficient memory allocation (2GB default). Elastic Search crashes with error 137, indicating out-of-memory issues when running temporal with Elasticsearch.

issues.title: Resetting a workflow multiple times
issues.author: antstorm
issues.summary: User reports inability to reset a workflow multiple times - the first reset succeeds, but subsequent reset requests return the runID of the second execution instead of creating a new reset. The issue reporter questions whether this is expected behavior or a bug.

issues.title: ParentClosePolicy ignores children that called continue as new
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: ParentClosePolicy's terminate action fails to terminate child workflows that have called continue-as-new or are cron workflows, because it uses the wrong RunID.

issues.title: tctl: Describe call fails if there is failure in pending activities
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: The tctl describe command fails when a workflow has pending activities with failures, unable to decode the failure details due to JSON unmarshaling into an incorrect Go type.

issues.title: Major differences from Cadence
issues.author: sheerun
issues.summary: User requests documentation comparing Temporal to its predecessor Cadence, noting major differences between the two projects.

issues.title: Support explicit infinite timeout for workflows
issues.author: rylandg
issues.summary: Workflows fail to start when TTL would exceed Cassandra's 2038-01-19 expiration limit. Request to support explicit infinite timeout to bypass this limitation when using Temporal with Cassandra.

issues.title: Cron workflow should have ability to stop cron job
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Cron workflows need the ability to stop scheduled executions without terminating currently running instances. This request supports use cases where users want to pause future executions or schedule workflows to run only once.

issues.title: Issue with timestamp for UI.  Always shows the last event timestamp for all jobs
issues.author: darewreck54
issues.summary: UI displays incorrect timestamps for workflows, always showing the most recent event timestamp instead of the correct timestamp for each individual workflow. This is a duplicate issue reported in the temporal-web repository.

issues.title: List Workflow Executions ignoring previous runs
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Users need to query the most recent workflow execution per workflow ID to identify which actors/workflows are currently in a failed state, filtering out those that have since recovered. Current list APIs return all executions, not the latest per workflow.

issues.title: Consider making runId optional for reset
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to make the runId parameter optional for workflow reset operations, as manually extracting and providing it is cumbersome and error-prone when users could rely on automatic extraction based on the workflow ID.

issues.title: Link to CLI docs is broken in CLI README
issues.author: rylandg
issues.summary: The CLI README contains a broken link to outdated external documentation. The link should point to https://docs.temporal.io/docs/learn-cli instead of https://docs.temporal.io/docs/08_cli.

issues.title: Use dashes in CLI arguments
issues.author: feedmeapples
issues.summary: CLI arguments should use dashes instead of underscores (e.g., --execution-timeout instead of --execution_timeout) to match standard CLI conventions and improve usability.

issues.title: Consider adding special state for workflows waiting to execute
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Cron workflows and workflows waiting to retry currently show the same status as other workflows until execution time. The request is to return a distinct status value from DescribeWorkflowExecution to indicate workflows in the 'waiting to execute' state.

issues.title: CLI: "workflow run" times out after 2 minutes.
issues.author: firdaus
issues.summary: The CLI 'workflow run' command times out after 2 minutes while polling for workflow completion events, even though the workflow continues executing. The gRPC connection used for history event streaming has a default 2-minute timeout that causes the client to stop polling.

issues.title: Try to run temporal on top of  Amazon Keyspaces
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to support Amazon Keyspaces as a persistence backend for Temporal. AWS Keyspaces claims to support LWT (Lightweight Transactions), which would enable Temporal to run on AWS's managed Cassandra-compatible database.

issues.title: Postgres plugin should support maxConns config
issues.author: chris-rcn
issues.summary: Postgres SQL plugin lacks maxConns configuration support that MySQL plugin already provides, limiting connection pool management capabilities for Postgres users.

issues.title: Ability to set up DB over TLS
issues.author: chris-rcn
issues.summary: Request to enable TLS support for database connections in temporal_sql_tool. The tool accepts TLS parameters but they are not being specified in the Docker startup script, leaving database connections unencrypted.

issues.title: Consider increasing default for frontend.visibilityListMaxQPS
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Users encounter 'RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED: Persistence Max QPS Reached for List Operations' errors with the default frontend.visibilityListMaxQPS setting. The current default was calibrated for internal Uber use but is too restrictive for the open source version.

issues.title: Make Dynamic Config File Injectable
issues.author: sunjiawen
issues.summary: User requested the ability to inject dynamic config files into the Temporal Docker image, making server configuration more flexible for containerized deployments. The request was resolved by confirming that dynamic config file paths are already configurable via the DYNAMIC_CONFIG_FILE_PATH environment variable.

issues.title: Listing Tasklist partitions crashes server
issues.author: samarabbas
issues.summary: Listing task list partitions crashes the server with a nil pointer dereference during protobuf marshaling. The crash occurs in TaskListPartitionMetadata.MarshalToSizedBuffer when a null partition metadata object is encountered.

issues.title: Statsd docker volume growth
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Statsd container in docker-compose grows to 7-8GB within days when the system is idle, causing excessive disk usage. The issue questions whether statsd should be included in the default development docker-compose setup.

issues.title: Ability for server to connect back to Cassandra when all host moves
issues.author: samarabbas
issues.summary: Gocql client resolves Cassandra hosts only once during session creation, causing cluster unavailability when all Cassandra hosts move simultaneously (e.g., in Kubernetes with persistent volumes). The server cannot reconnect even after hosts come back online.

issues.title: Document ElasticSearch version requirement
issues.author: markmark206
issues.summary: ElasticSearch version requirement (6.x) needs to be clearly documented. The issue also requests better error handling when this requirement is not met to improve user experience.

issues.title: Support ElasticSearch 7
issues.author: markmark206
issues.summary: Add support for ElasticSearch 7 to replace the current ElasticSearch 6 dependency. Custom search attributes fail to work properly with ES7 because the mapping doesn't include them, preventing searches from functioning correctly.

issues.title: Change default order for listClosedWorkflowExecutions to by close time [Cassandra Visibility Store]
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: The Cassandra Visibility Store orders closed workflow queries by start_time instead of close_time, which is confusing and prevents filtering workflows by close time. The default ordering should be changed to close_time for closed workflows.

issues.title: Make long poll interval configurable through the service config
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Long poll intervals are currently hardcoded in the service configuration and cannot be modified, which prevents clients from adjusting these values without breaking due to deadline constraints.

issues.title: Reduce the memory footprint of docker-compose-es
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Reduce memory consumption of the docker-compose-es development environment, particularly for ElasticSearch and Cassandra containers, to make it feasible to run on developer machines with limited resources.

issues.title: Add binaries to the release artifacts
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to provide prebuilt binaries for the Temporal service and tctl command-line tool as release artifacts, as an alternative to Docker for users who don't use containerization.

issues.title: Temporal should support Server TLS
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: Add support for Server TLS/SSL to secure gRPC communication in Temporal. Server TLS and mutual TLS authentication are now supported across all components except Temporal CLI and Temporal Web.

issues.title: tctl doesn't list open workflow execution
issues.author: feedmeapples
issues.summary: tctl's `wf listall --open` command fails to list open workflow executions, even though they are visible in Temporal Web. The issue occurs when querying a running workflow after starting it via the Go sample.

issues.title: ErrQueryWorkflowBeforeFirstDecision should not be "invalid argument" failure
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: The QueryWorkflowBeforeFirstDecision error is incorrectly classified as an InvalidArgument failure when it should be a QueryFailed error, since it's related to workflow state rather than the request itself.

issues.title: Evaluate if the QueryConsistencyLevel.Eventual should exist
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Evaluation of whether QueryConsistencyLevel.Eventual should exist as an option. The enum was ultimately removed with default behavior changed to Strong consistency.

issues.title: Support embedded version of the service
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to support running Temporal as an embedded library with only a database dependency, similar to NATS's in-process server model, to enable small-scale on-premises deployments without requiring a separate server process.

issues.title: what happens to uber cadence now?
issues.author: listaction
issues.summary: Community discussion about the future of Uber Cadence in light of the Temporal project's launch. Uber Cadence team provided a statement reaffirming their commitment to the Cadence project's continued development and collaboration with the Temporal open-source community.

issues.title: Return LongPollExpirationInterval on poll call results
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to return LongPollExpirationInterval in poll call results so worker code can automatically adjust long poll intervals. Should be included in timeout errors returned by the frontend.

issues.title: Fix names of dynamic config properties
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Dynamic config property names are inconsistent across the codebaseâ€”some use uppercase, others lowercase; some use abbreviations like 'num' and 'max', others use full words. Component prefixes are also inconsistently applied, and alphabetic organization by component would improve maintainability.

issues.title: Activity timeouts and retry policy redesign
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Activity timeout and retry policy design has fundamental issues: ScheduleToClose timeout conflicts with RetryPolicy.expiration, and activities default to no retries which is counterintuitive. Proposal to redesign timeouts as real intervals, merge retry policy into activity attributes, and make unlimited retries the default with configurable MaximumAttempts.

issues.title: Namespace lookup is case sensitive
issues.author: darewreck54
issues.summary: Namespace lookup in the UI and API is case-sensitive, but namespace names are displayed in lowercase. Clicking on a namespace in the UI fails because it constructs URLs with the lowercased name instead of the original case-sensitive name that the service expects.

issues.title: Feature: add example with cockroachdb
issues.author: hazcod
issues.summary: Request to add a Docker Compose example using CockroachDB as the database for Temporal. User wanted to demonstrate running Temporal with CockroachDB, a PostgreSQL-compatible cloud-native database.

issues.title: Feature: add option to auto-create domain
issues.author: hazcod
issues.summary: Feature request to automatically create domains/namespaces if they don't exist when clients connect, reducing manual setup complexity in microservices deployments where re-deploys happen frequently.

issues.title: Make ScheduleToStart timeout optional
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Make ScheduleToStart timeout optional for activities by defaulting it to the workflow execution timeout. Currently both ScheduleToStart and StartToClose are required when ScheduleToClose is not specified, but defaulting ScheduleToStart would simplify the common case.

issues.title: Fix handling of immediate child workflow cancellation
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: When a single decision batch contains both StartChildWorkflowExecution and RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecution, the cancellation fails and the child workflow is started instead. The system should immediately cancel the child workflow by writing appropriate cancellation events to history.

issues.title: Matching service degradation due to large number of task lists
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Matching service experiences significant performance degradation when exposed to a large number of task lists, with symptoms including memory pressure and database timer operations on UpdateTaskList calls. Performance recovers after process restart.

issues.title: Error: "requested workflow history does not exist"
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Worker fails to process decision tasks with "requested workflow history does not exist" error when running the branch sample. The issue occurs during workflow execution with multiple parallel activities, causing decision task completion failure.

issues.title: Do not cancel or terminate the cron workflow if runID is specified
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Customer requested ability to terminate or cancel a single run of a cron workflow without killing the entire cron job. Currently, terminating/canceling a cron workflow always stops all runs, not just the specified one.

issues.title: Cassandra timestamp type
issues.author: wxing1292
issues.summary: Cassandra timestamp type used in the schema can lose precision, potentially causing timers to fire earlier than expected due to rounding errors. The issue raises concerns about data integrity when the database modifies stored values without explicit consent.

issues.title: TestMatcherSuite/TestMustOfferRemoteMatch is flaky
issues.author: samarabbas
issues.summary: A test in the matcher component (TestMustOfferRemoteMatch) is flaky, failing intermittently with nil pointer and assertion errors. The test expects specific values for task list names and partition keys but sometimes receives empty strings instead.

issues.title: Fix the values of attempt field
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: The attempt field in ActivityTaskStarted is confusing because it starts at 0 for the first execution. Should either start at 1 for consistency or be renamed to retryCount for clarity.

issues.title: CLI SIGSEGV
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: CLI command `tctl workflow list -op` crashes with SIGSEGV (nil pointer dereference) in the appendWorkflowExecutionsToTable function. The same command works without the -op option.

issues.title: Validate dynamic configuration initialization
issues.author: samarabbas
issues.summary: Dynamic configuration initialization is failing on local dev setups, spamming logs with errors about missing keys. The issue is that development.yaml path doesn't resolve correctly, causing repeated warnings for each ServiceRole.

issues.title: Split GetWorkflowExecutionHistory to two RPCs
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: The GetWorkflowExecutionHistory RPC should be split into two separate endpoints: one for normal polling and one for long-polling with WaitForNewEvent. This change would improve API clarity and allow clients to set appropriate timeouts for each use case.

issues.title: Review JSON serialization
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Review and standardize JSON serialization across the codebase by replacing native json.Marshal/Unmarshal with proto serialization and JSONPBEncoder. Several components still need updates including archiver, elasticsearch, persistence, mysql, and history modules.

issues.title: Task list with rate limiting per key
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Feature request for rate limiting per dynamically created partition keys in task lists. Users need to limit concurrent activity execution based on custom keys (e.g., per customer) without managing client-side workers manually.

issues.title: Publish Temporal Helm Chart
issues.author: markmark206
issues.summary: Request to publish an official Helm Chart for Temporal to enable easy installation, upgrading, and rolling back of Temporal instances. The chart has been created and published, though upgrade and rollback functionality are tracked separately.

issues.title: retry activity get timeout error
issues.author: samarabbas
issues.summary: Activity retry policy loses important error details when the last retry attempt times out before the expiration deadline. Users need access to the last application error instead of just the timeout error to make informed workflow decisions.

issues.title: Absolute Expiry/Creation Time should be provided by Add*Tasks Callers
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: Matching service recomputes task expiry times using relative timeouts, causing incorrect metrics in forwarding scenarios. Both task expiry and creation time should use absolute timestamps provided by callers rather than computed locally.

issues.title: CLI hangs if domain doesn't exist
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: The CLI hangs when attempting to list workflows in a domain that doesn't exist. The command `./cadence -do sample workflow list` blocks indefinitely instead of returning an error when the specified domain is not found.

issues.title: Remove mocks from repo
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Convert all mocks in the repository to be generated on-the-fly using mockgen, similar to the gRPC mock generation process. This involves removing unused mocks and organizing generated mocks in a separate package structure.

issues.title: Decide right default for EmitMetric attribute of Domain Config
issues.author: samarabbas
issues.summary: Decision needed on the default value for EmitMetric attribute in Domain Config. Currently defaults to false, requiring users to explicitly enable metrics for each domain. The issue proposes three options: default to true (not recommended for protobuf), keep false and require explicit opt-in, or rename to DisableMetric to enable by default.

issues.title: Add check that prohibits cross domain calls for global domains
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Add validation to prohibit cross-domain calls for global domains, which are currently broken due to domains being active in different data centers. This temporary validation will prevent failures until full cross-domain support for global domains is implemented.

issues.title: Support continue as new for cron workflows
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Cron workflows internally used continue as new to schedule the next run, which conflicted with user workflows that called continue as new explicitly. The proposal is to allow explicit continue as new calls while automatically scheduling the next run only when the workflow completes.

issues.title: Add Admin CLI Command to inspect DB ClusterMembership
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: Request to add an Admin CLI command to inspect the DB cluster_membership table, allowing comparison with Ringpop membership information for cluster state inspection.

issues.title: Investigate why upgrading gocql breaks paging
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: An upgrade to gocql library breaks paging behavior in Cassandra queries. The issue was temporarily fixed by reverting to an older version, but a proper investigation is needed to understand the behavioral differences and find a way to use a newer gocql version.

issues.title: Replace OneboxService interface with Resource
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Remove the leftover OneboxService interface used only in onebox workers and replace it with the standard Resource interface used throughout the codebase.

issues.title: Different retry options based on failure type
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to support different retry policies based on failure type, allowing intermittent errors to retry immediately while non-transient errors retry with longer intervals or not at all.

issues.title: Add cron activity
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to add cron scheduling support for activities, similar to existing workflow cron functionality. Users want the ability to automatically re-execute activities on a schedule or manually schedule the next invocation from within the activity.

issues.title: Set Explicit Default for all Timestamp Values in MySQL Schema
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: MySQL schema for clusterMembership table has implicit timestamp default behavior that differs between MySQL 5.7 and 8.0, causing deployment failures. The issue requires explicit DEFAULT values for all TIMESTAMP columns to ensure consistent cross-version compatibility.

issues.title: Docker: Docker image with schema loaded
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Initial docker-compose startup is slow due to schema creation. Request to ship Docker container with pre-populated schema to speed up developer setup, or explore other optimization approaches.

issues.title: Make temporal docker to not emit noisy logs
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Temporal Docker container emits excessive noisy logs (99.9% useless) without clear service readiness indication. Proposal is to emit startup/ready messages and only fatal errors by default, with optional verbose logging for troubleshooting.

issues.title: Add metadata header to all blob payload fields
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Add metadata headers to all blob payload fields to support encoding schemes, encryption, compression, and encoding information for interoperability across services and migration scenarios.

issues.title: Remove 30 days maximum retention limit
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Remove the 30-day maximum retention limit that was inherited from Cadence. This limit is problematic for external users with low event rates who don't use archival, as it forces them to configure retention within an arbitrary constraint.

issues.title: Remove InterruptedException from WorkflowQueue
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Remove InterruptedException from WorkflowQueue since workflow code never throws it, as CancellationScope should be used for cancellation instead.

issues.title: Allow signalling external workflow with no input
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Workflow cannot signal external workflows without providing input, despite this being allowed when signalling from outside. This inconsistency causes BadRequestError when attempting to signal without input.

issues.title: EventId and Version default values
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Default values for EventId and Version fields were changed to EmptyEventID and EmptyVersion constants, but this is error-prone since new objects require explicit setting. Proposal to change constant values to 0, which would serve as a proper 'unset' indicator for EventIds (which start at 1), pending verification that Versions also start at 1.

issues.title: Refactor Failure representation in the APIs
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Refactor the Failure representation in APIs to use a generic protobuf structure for error chains instead of language-specific serialization formats. This enables proper error chaining across SDKs implemented in different languages.

issues.title: Repos rename proposal
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Proposal to rename Temporal repositories for clarity: temporal â†’ temporal-server, temporal-go-client â†’ temporal-go-sdk, and temporal-java-client â†’ temporal-java-sdk. Also includes entity renames as referenced in design documentation.

issues.title: Group and categorize tests
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Reorganize tests into clear categories (pure unit, integration with database/mocks, integration without mocks using onebox, and end-to-end) with dedicated Makefile targets and local run instructions.

issues.title: Persisting Ringpop Membership & Custom Host Identity
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: Redesign cluster membership discovery and host identity management to use the persistence layer instead of Ringpop seed configuration, supporting custom host identities and separate broadcast addresses for NAT'd networking setups.

issues.title: Use a code-generator for boilerplate/'generic' code
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: Proposal to use code generators to eliminate boilerplate and hand-maintained code in persistence clients and resource implementations. This would improve development speed and safety by centralizing changes.

issues.title: Remove V1 for everything that have V2
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Remove deprecated V1 API definitions from proto files where V2 versions exist. This involves deleting the V1 message/RPC definitions and removing the V2 suffix from the V2 versions to make them the new standard.

issues.title: Refactor Makefile
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Refactor the Makefile to remove Thrift-related targets after gRPC migration and consolidate remaining targets. Update golint installation to prevent command not found errors during builds.

issues.title: Use a SQL Generator for SQL-type DBs
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: Reduce persistence layer boilerplate by implementing a SQL query builder for SQL-based databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) instead of maintaining separate implementations for each database type. This would enable faster feature development and reduce database-specific bugs while maintaining support for Cassandra.

issues.title: Move canary to separate repo
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Move the canary testing system out of the main server repository to a separate dedicated repository. Currently it resides in the server repo due to legacy reasons and needs to be decoupled.

issues.title: Workflow service decomposition
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Decompose the workflow service gRPC API by extracting replication and metadata operations into separate services (ReplicationService and MetadataService) to improve service organization and reduce coupling.

issues.title: Use dependency injection
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Replace the service locator pattern (Resource and RPCFactory) with proper dependency injection using a compile-time dependency container like Wire or Uber FX to improve testability and maintainability.

issues.title: Use gRPC load balancer for frontend
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Temporal needs a flexible, pluggable load balancing mechanism for gRPC frontend connections to replace the previous YARPC dispatcher pattern, supporting round-robin and custom load balancers.

issues.title: NumHistoryShards should be persisted and enforced after being initially configured
issues.author: shawnhathaway
issues.summary: NumHistoryShards configuration value can currently be changed after initial cluster setup, which should not be allowed. The issue proposes persisting this value in a new CLUSTER_METADATA table and enforcing consistency between config and persisted values.

issues.title: Failure reason is passed as string with hardcoded format
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Failure reasons are hardcoded as strings with proto enum values, creating a fragile contract between server and client. The string format (e.g., 'cadenceInternal:Timeout TimeoutTypeStartToClose') should be replaced with a proper proto/thrift enum field.

issues.title: TLS for MySQL
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to add TLS support for MySQL database connections. This enhancement was implemented to support secure database communication for both MySQL and PostgreSQL.

issues.title: Consider migration from gogo to vtprotobuf
issues.author: alexshtin
issues.summary: Migration from gogo/protobuf to a modern, actively maintained Protocol Buffers library. The team evaluated multiple options including protobuf-go, vtprotobuf, and csproto before ultimately deciding to migrate to the standard Google library.

issues.title: Add workers autoscaling through KEDA
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Request to add workers autoscaling capability through KEDA (Kubernetes Event Driven Autoscaling). This involves integrating KEDA as a product integration to enable automatic scaling of Temporal workers based on event-driven metrics.

issues.title: Port Go service and client to the new error handling
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Update Temporal Server's error handling to use Go's new error checking methods (errors.Is and errors.As) instead of type assertions and comparisons, following Go's error handling best practices.

issues.title: Add header to each payload
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Payloads need associated metadata to support different serialization formats, compression, and encryption algorithms. Currently, there's no standardized way to specify these properties across different payload types.

issues.title: Handling private repos with DockerFile
issues.author: ntayyab
issues.summary: Investigation into a better approach for handling Docker builds with private repositories. The Dockerfile was updated to support the private temporal repo, but needs a more sustainable solution (multiple Dockerfile versions or Makefile docker target) for when the repo becomes public.

issues.title: Clear indication that service is up and running
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Add a clear startup message to the Temporal service logs indicating when the service is up and running. Currently, users starting the service via docker-compose lack visual confirmation that initialization is complete.

issues.title: Multi-phase activities
issues.author: mfateev
issues.summary: Activities with multiple phases need different timeouts for each phase. Currently, users work around this by creating separate activities and using workflow signals, but this complicates code. The proposal is to model activity execution as a list of phases, each with its own timeout and retry policy.
